creator.name: Gouverneur / Commandeur van Essequebo en Demerary
creator.name_english: Governor / Commander of Essequibo and Demerara
creator.his_func:
When the West India Company (WIC) was reorganized in 1674, the WIC or the Zeeland Chamber administered the colony of Essequibo, to which Demerara was added in a subordinate position in 1740-1772. In later years the position of Demerara changed compared to Essequibo; in 1812 Demerara had become the main settlement. The Commanders and Governors were assisted by two councils: a Council of Policy and a Council of Criminal and Civil Justice.

An important administrator in the 18th century was Laurens Storm van 's Gravesande. He governed Essequibo from 1743 to 1772 and Demerara until 1750. In that year he received the title of Director-General from the WIC, while his son Jonathan became Commander of Demerara.
